alert.note: Alert for Randolph (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued March 26 at 10:35PM CDT until March 27 at 1:00AM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1130 PM CDT FOR LEE...SOUTHERN RANDOLPH...MACON...TALLAPOOSA AND CHAMBERS COUNTIES... At 1035 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Dadeville to near Still Waters Resort to Liverpool, moving east at 55 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Auburn, Opelika, Alexander City, Tuskegee, Valley, Lanett, Roanoke, Dadeville, Camp Hill, Notasulga, Smiths, Stroud, Milstead, Lafayette, Smiths Station, La Fayette, Jacksons` Gap, New Site, Wadley and Shorter. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 100 AM CDT for southeastern and east central Alabama. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
